author: Peter Atencio
title: PH nears AFC futsal tournament proper seat
text:
Showing courage and determination, the Philippine national women‚Äôs futsal team pulled off a 2-0 victory over Turkmenistan on Wednesday night in the Asian Football Confederation (AFC) Women‚Äôs Futsal Asian Cup China 2025 Group C qualifiers in Tashkent, Uzbekistan.
The performance immediately drew praises from fans and the team‚Äôs mother federation.
‚ÄúWe are very happy of the way the girls are performing. We wish they can continue with this until the end of the tournament,‚Äù said Philippine Football Federation secretary general Angelo Mercader. ‚ÄúThe girls have shown their competitive spirit, palaban sila.‚Äù
It was the Philippines‚Äô second win in the tournament, following a 3-0 draw with host Uzbekistan earlier in the qualifiers.
The victory also kept the Filipinas at the top of Group C and strengthened their chances of reaching the finals in four months.
Katrina Guillou opened scoring in the 22nd minute, while Dionesia Tolentin sealed the win with a second goal in the 29th.
Their combined efforts propelled the Filipinas closer to earning a slot in the tournament proper, scheduled from May 7 to 18.
Football officials said the team has turned around since its revamp last wee, following a disappointing showing during the recent 2024 ASEAN Women‚Äôs Futsal Championship.
The first goal was a result of a well-orchestrated play. Cathrine Graversen initiated the attack by setting up Judy Connolly, who delivered a precise pass to Guillou.
Guillou skillfully dribbled past defenders and found the net just outside the box.
New coach Rafael Merino, with national women‚Äôs football team coach Mark Torcaso assisting him, has kept the Filipinas in fighting shape.
As the 30th minute approached, Tolentin capitalized on an error by Turkmenistan‚Äôs keeper, Malika Eminova.
Tolentin intercepted a stray pass to Maya Musaskaya and sent the ball into the unguarded net.
Later Wednesday evening, Uzbekistan defeated Kuwait 5-0 to retain third place and stay in contention with a 1-1-0 record.

author: @iltempo_official
title: Hamas e Israele sono d'accordo sulla tregua e il rilascio degli ostaggi. La svolta
text:
Gaza, c'√® l'accordo Israele-Hamas per la tregua: la conferma palestinese
Semaforo verde sulla tregua a Gaza. Hamas avrebbe infatti approvato la prima fase di un accordo per il rilascio degli ostaggi, in cambio di garanzie americane su un completo ritiro di Israele dalla Striscia in 124 giorni, a completamento delle tre fasi che comporrebbero l‚Äôintesa. A rivelarlo √® una fonte dei miliziani palestinesi citata dall‚Äôemittente israeliana Channel 12, secondo cui le garanzie americane sarebbero state fatte pervenire per il tramite dei mediatori egiziani e qatarini che oggi incontreranno al Cairo esponenti di Hamas. L‚Äôaccordo prevederebbe inoltre la promessa sostenuta dagli Stati Uniti che Israele non avvier√† la prevista operazione nella citt√† meridionale di Rafah, nell‚Äôenclave palestinese.
Ostaggio gi√† morto da tempo: la triste notizia dal kibbutz israeliano
L‚Äôultima proposta di accordo prevederebbe una prima fase di durata fino a 40 giorni durante la quale 33 ostaggi tenuti a Gaza verrebbero rilasciati e l‚ÄôIdf si ritirerebbe da parte della Striscia. La seconda fase si estenderebbe fino a 42 giorni durante i quali verrebbero rilasciati tutti gli altri ostaggi ancora in vita e le parti si accorderebbero sulle condizioni di un ritorno alla calma a Gaza. Durerebbe 42 giorni anche la terza ed ultima fase, dedicata alla consegna dei corpi senza vita.
Caos nei campus Usa, Biden dice no all'antisemitismo: "Linguaggio d'odio"
Nel corso della prima fase √® anche previsto il rientro della popolazione palestinese che si √® rifugiata nel sud di Gaza nella parte settentrionale della Striscia: Israele, secondo gli Stati Uniti, avrebbe accettato un rientro senza limitazioni della popolazione nelle aree di provenienza. Nel quadro dell‚Äôintesa √® previsto inoltre il rilascio di centinaia di prigionieri palestinesi. La fonte di Hamas citata da Channel 12 ha parlato di ¬´compromessi raggiunti¬ª sul numero di detenuti da rilasciare in cambio della liberazione di ciascun ostaggio. La notizia riportata oggi dal Times of Israel segue l‚Äôannuncio di Hamas che nella tarda serata di ieri ha reso noto che una sua delegazione andr√† al Cairo ¬´determinata a raggiungere un accordo tale da soddisfare le richieste palestinesi¬ª. La guerra va avanti dal 7 ottobre e ora sembra proprio essere arrivato il tempo della pace. Restando sempre in attesa degli annunci ufficiali, con la notizia che √® stata per√≤ confermata dal quotidiano palestinese Al-Quds, che fa sapere che Hamas annuncer√† l‚Äôapprovazione dell‚Äôultima proposta di cessate il fuoco e rilascio degli ostaggi nelle prossime ore.
Dai blog
Controtempo []https://www.iltempo.it/blog/carlo-antini/2024/04/30/news/ermal-meta-buona-fortuna-dedicato-figlia-primo-maggio-roma-noemi-39185350/
La nuova vita di Ermal Meta: "Buona Fortuna √® dedicato a mia figlia" Carlo Antini https://www.iltempo.it/blog/carlo-antini/2024/04/25/news/rock-in-roma-tommaso-paradiso-annalisa-placebo-club-dogo-capannelle-cavea-39145612/
Da Tommaso Paradiso a Annalisa, estate a tempo di Rock in Roma Carlo Antini Qui Lazio
Impresa sfiorata, Lazio eliminata Luigi Salomone

author: @infoitscienza
title: iPhone 15 crolla al MINIMO STORICO, fai l'affare prima che termini!
text:
iPhone 15 crolla al MINIMO STORICO, fai l'affare prima che termini!
Articolo Precedente
Articolo Successivo
Se siete alla ricerca di un'occasione imperdibile per entrare nel mondo Apple o aggiornare il vostro dispositivo, questa offerta su Amazon potrebbe essere quella giusta. L'iPhone 15 √® ora disponibile al prezzo speciale di 691,99‚Ç¨, con uno sconto del 21% rispetto al prezzo di listino di 879‚Ç¨, permettendovi di risparmiare ben 187‚Ç¨!
Per non perderti nessun affare del Black Friday corri a scoprire la nostra pagina dedicata!
Apple iPhone 15, chi dovrebbe acquistarlo?
L'iPhone 15 rappresenta la scelta ideale per gli utenti che ricercano l'eccellenza tecnologica unita a un design raffinato. [(Tom's Hardware Italia)](https://www.tomshw.it/smartphone/iphone-15-crolla-al-minimo-storico-fai-laffare-prima-che-termini-BGH)
Su altre testate
Non ci sono novit√† nella confezione che ovviamente contiene quindi solo il cavo in corda USB-C e niente altro. Peccato che questo cavo non supporti la massima velocit√† di trasmissione di questo smartphone, ovvero 10 Gbps. [(SmartWorld)](https://www.smartworld.it/recensioni/iphone-16-pro)
su Amazon iPhone 15 (128 GB) in vari colori a 731 euro (sconto 17%) [(Today.it)](https://www.today.it/best/sconti-offerte/offerta-iphone-amazon.html)
Pi√π precisamente, l‚Äôofferta su Amazon vede l‚ÄôiPhone 15 disponibile a 691,99‚Ç¨ ed √® attualmente valida per le seguenti colorazioni: Sebbene non sia un‚Äôofferta specifica del Black Friday, su Amazon √® possibile trovare numerosi sconti interessanti e uno di questi riguarda l‚ÄôiPhone 15 che nel taglio di memoria da 128GB viene offerto a meno di 700‚Ç¨ in tre colori diversi. [(iPhone Italia)](https://www.iphoneitalia.com/832396/iphone-15-in-offerta-su-amazon)
Continuano a essere disponibili anche i pacchetti con iPhone 16 e AirPods 4 con cancellazione attiva del rumore, in questo caso con gli stessi prezzi a rate precedenti. A partire da oggi, 13 Novembre 2024, per i clienti TIM sono disponibili nuovi prezzi pi√π bassi per i pacchetti con iPhone 16 e Apple Watch Series 10, scontati adesso di 390 euro anzich√© 90 euro. [(MondoMobileWeb.it)](https://www.mondomobileweb.it/290660-tim-nuovi-sconti-per-iphone-16-con-apple-watch-series-10-novita-per-tim-next-evolution/)
Pubblicit√† Apple ha diffuso un nuovo spot dedicato all‚ÄôiPhone, pubblicit√† che mostra un ambiente stile sala di controllo della NASA. Sulla ‚Äúrampa di lancio‚Äù non c‚Äô√® un razzo ma un iPhone 16 Pro. [(macitynet.it)](https://www.macitynet.it/apple-nel-nuovo-spot-per-iphone-16-pro-in-evidenza-il-chip-a18-pro/)
Giornata di sconti molto interessanti sulla gamma Apple iPhone: iPhone 16, 14 e 13 sono tutti al prezzo pi√π basso degli ultimi 30 giorni su Amazon. Per iPhone 16 √® il prezzo pi√π basso dal lancio. [(DDay.it)](https://dday.it/redazione/51102/voglia-di-iphone-oggi-e-il-giorno-giusto-su-amazon-sono-tutti-in-offerta-anche-iphone-16)

author: Frontaly
title: Declarado c√≥mplice de 15 homicidios pol√≠ticos un ex jefe del Ej√©rcito | Acento
text: La Justicia chilena determin√≥ este jueves la complicidad del excomandante en jefe del Ej√©rcito Juan Emilio Cheyre Espinoza en 15 homicidios calificados ocurridos en 1973, espec√≠ficamente en la operaci√≥n conocida como 'Caravana de la Muerte', siniestra comitiva militar que recorri√≥ Chile con el fin de asesinar opositores pol√≠ticos durante los primeros meses de la dictadura c√≠vico-militar de Augusto Pinochet (1973-1990). El condenado fue en 2003 el primer comandante en jefe del Ej√©rcito en pedir un "nunca m√°s" abusos a los derechos humanos. Cheyre Espinoza es el cuarto sucesor de Pinochet enjuiciado por violaci√≥nes de los derechos humanos y/o tambi√©n por corrupci√≥n. Sobre esto √∫ltimo, se estima que los herederos de Pinochet podr√≠an ser condenados a pagar unos 16 millones de d√≥lares debido a que son los destinatarios del corrupto provecho econ√≥mico del dictador, monto que se ha descubierto y que se sospecha que es solo una parte de lo robado. Particularmente, la Corte Suprema determin√≥ que se incurri√≥ en error al calificar inicialmente la participaci√≥n atribuida al condenado Cheyre Espinoza como encubridor de los homicidios. Ahora se ha establecido su complicidad por lo que se ha condenado al exmilitar a cinco a√±os de presidio. Sin embargo, Cheyre cumplir√° una pena sustitutiva de libertad vigilada intensiva considerando su "irreprochable conducta anterior". Se le impusieron tambi√©n las penas accesorias de inhabilitaci√≥n absoluta perpetua para derechos pol√≠ticos y la de inhabilitaci√≥n absoluta para cargos y oficios p√∫blicos durante el tiempo de la condena y al pago de las costas de la causa. Cheyre ha sido procesado adem√°s por casos de malversaci√≥n de fondos p√∫blicos en el marco de una investigaci√≥n por fraude en la instituci√≥n castrense. En la misma sentencia, el m√°ximo tribunal chileno resolvi√≥ elevar las penas de nueve militares en retiro por el homicidio calificado de los 15 opositores, todos fusilados el 16 de octubre de 1973 y siendo incluso algunos de ellos rematados con un tiro de gracia, seg√∫n estableci√≥ la investigaci√≥n judicial. En el fallo, la Segunda Sala del tribunal supremo dictamin√≥ que Pedro Espinoza Bravo y Juan Chiminelli Fullerton enfrentar√°n 15 a√±os, en tanto V√≠ctor Hugo Alegr√≠a Rodr√≠guez, Jaime Ojeda Torrent y Emilio de la Mahotiere Gonz√°lez recibir√°n penas de 10 a√±os y un d√≠a de presidio. Hern√°n Valdebenito Buggman, Guillermo Raby Arancibia y Luis Araos Flores fueron sentenciados a 5 a√±os y un d√≠a de presidio como encubridores. Seg√∫n la resoluci√≥n del tribunal, "la reuni√≥n entre la Comitiva y una parte del personal del Regimiento de Artiller√≠a N¬∞ 2 Arica de La Serena -donde Cheyre era teniente- corresponde a un momento previo a los delitos cometidos y en ella se revisaron los antecedentes estad√≠sticos de quienes se buscaba acelerar los procesos que afectaban a detenidos pol√≠ticos y en su caso, de inmediato proceder a ejecutarles‚Äù. ‚ÄúTal tarea era propia de quienes conformaban el c√≠rculo m√°s selecto de la Unidad Militar que era visitada por la Comitiva (‚Ä¶) sus principales part√≠cipes eran, entre otros, Sergio Arellano Stark, Marcelo Moren Brito, Ariosto Lapostol Orrego, Manuel Cazanga Pereira y, adem√°s, quien era el ayudante del primer mando del Regimiento, el sentenciado Juan Emilio Cheyre Espinoza‚Äù, reza el fallo. La dictadura en Chile dur√≥ 17 a√±os y dej√≥ m√°s de 40.000 v√≠ctimas, entre ejecutados, detenidos desaparecidos, prisioneros pol√≠ticos y torturados, seg√∫n cifras de la comisi√≥n oficial que recopil√≥ testimonios de v√≠ctimas y familiares. M√°s de 3.200 chilenos murieron a manos de agentes del Estado. Durante el Gobierno del actual presidente chileno, Gabriel Boric, se dio luz verde a una in√©dita pol√≠tica de b√∫squeda de v√≠ctimas de desaparici√≥n forzada durante el r√©gimen pinochetista, que busca esclarecer el destino de los desaparecidos, que se calculan en torno a las 1.469 personas, de las que solo se han encontrado 307. El proceso incluye, adem√°s, rendici√≥n de cuentas a la sociedad chilena sobre el avance de estas diligencias, junto con la implementaci√≥n de medidas de reparaci√≥n y garant√≠as de no repetici√≥n de la comisi√≥n de este tipo de cr√≠menes. (CON INFORMACIONES DE LAS AGENCIAS EFE Y AFP)

author: UC Irvine Donald Bren School of Information & Computer Sciences
title: Code for Care: MedTech Innovation Hackathon - UC Irvine Donald Bren School of Information & Computer Sciences
text:
Code for Care: MedTech Innovation Hackathon
What happens when you bring together physicians, researchers and software engineering students to tackle real-world medical challenges? UC Irvine‚Äôs Department of Informatics and Department of Anesthesiology & Perioperative Care decided to find out with the [MedTech Innovation Hackathon](https://sites.uci.edu/medtechinnovate).
‚ÄúThe keyword here is multidisciplinary,‚Äù says Professor [Mohammad Moshirpour](https://ics.uci.edu/people/mohammad-moshirpour/) of the Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences ([ICS](http://www.ics.uci.edu)), who collaborated with [Dr. Cameron Ricks](https://medschool.uci.edu/about/faculty/cricks) of the School of Medicine to plan the joint hackathon. The event, which took place October 25 and 26, 2024, challenged UCI students ‚Äî in particular, those in the Master of Software Engineering ([MSWE](https://mswe.ics.uci.edu/)) program ‚Äî to develop innovative applications to enhance doctors‚Äô efficiency and improve the overall patient healthcare experience.
‚ÄúThe doctors and medical staff have so many great ideas but often don‚Äôt know how to make them a reality,‚Äù says Ricks. The MedTech Innovation Hackathon aimed to bridge that gap.
‚ÄúWe have at least a hundred capable software engineers at any given time who are ready to create value,‚Äù says Moshirpour, who serves as director of the professional MSWE program. The hackathon presented an opportunity for these students to create prototypes that help bring the doctors‚Äô ideas to life.
A Hackathon for Healthcare Innovation
The hackathon was centered around six different ‚Äúpotential product‚Äù statements, crafted by physicians and researchers in the field of anesthesiology and perioperative care:
- Pre-op education app that answers common patient questions before surgery.
- Pacemaker translator that simplifies pacemaker/AICD printouts for anesthesiologists by developing software that translates complex data into easily understandable language.
- MedLedger system for tracking medical competencies, potentially using blockchain technology.
- Trackstar system for gait analysis and treatment that offers an accessible, real-time solution for diagnosing and addressing foot-related abnormalities.
- ECHO (Efficient Capture and Helpful Output) platform that leverages AI to transform audio and video recordings into useful resources for students, faculty, and team leaders.
- AI-generated Queries from Patients‚Äô EMR software that streamlines the preoperative evaluation process by efficiently extracting relevant patient information from extensive electronic medical records (EMRs).
Around 40 students participated in the event and, unlike a typical hackathon, they had more than two days to think about their solutions.
‚ÄúA lot of times in hackathons, it takes people a while to wrap their brains around the challenge, but this wasn‚Äôt a blind event where you just show up and start working,‚Äù says Moshirpour.
‚ÄúWe started to advertise these projects mid-September, so students could select which problem they wanted to tackle.‚Äù
Teams were then assigned on October 14, and participants spent the following week meeting with physicians and coming up with a preliminary design. ‚ÄúBecause we had given them context a couple of weeks prior, they came in focused,‚Äù explains Moshirpour. Teams could immediately get to work on October 25, and by 1 p.m. the following day, they each presented their solutions. Two expert judges, Google software engineer [Pierce Taylor](https://www.linkedin.com/in/piercetaylor/), an ICS alum, and [Dr. John Hsu](https://www.linkedin.com/in/john-hsu-md-300a8b2a/), cofounder of [iPill Dispenser](https://www.ipilldispenser.com/), deliberated after the presentations and announced the winners.
‚ÄúThe hackathon was a great opportunity to think about real-world healthcare needs and how technology could make a meaningful difference,‚Äù says [Adithya Mohan Vardhan](https://www.linkedin.com/in/amvardha/), who served as project manager for the first-place team. Vardhan worked with fellow MSWE students Shlok Jain, Daniel Rivas, Sylvia Chao and Han Wang to develop software for EMR queries (project #6). ‚ÄúWe built a generative AI tool designed to process and summarize vast electronic medical records with high precision. Our emphasis was on ensuring both accuracy and relevance, understanding that reliable information is crucial in medical decision-making. This meant implementing extensive testing and fine-tuning to handle a diverse array of medical queries.‚Äù
The Scribe.ai team, which also worked on project #6, tied for second place with a team working on the pacemaker translator (project #2).
Third place went to the team developing a learning management system to streamline preoperative care provided to patients (project #1). ‚ÄúParticipating in this hackathon was an exciting opportunity to tackle real-world healthcare challenges,‚Äù says project manager [Sanmith Kurian](https://www.linkedin.com/in/sanmith/). ‚ÄúWorking on this solution allowed us to explore innovative approaches and leverage emerging technologies. I truly appreciated the chance to work on a meaningful project that has the potential to make a difference in healthcare.‚Äù
The students were able to build their portfolio, while the physicians walked away with a functioning prototype. Overall, the unique hackathon was a win-win event that Moshirpour hopes to duplicate.
The MSWE Dev Shop
‚ÄúWe‚Äôve started this initiative called the MSWE Dev Shop, which is open to the entire campus as well as other companies,‚Äù says Moshirpour. ‚ÄúThe Dev Shop presents a systematic way of connecting our great pool of talent to local needs. Essentially, we‚Äôll be offering constant prototyping hackathons throughout the year.‚Äù
Ricks plans to continue working with Moshirpour to build on the MedTech Hackathon‚Äôs success. ‚ÄúThis was the first hackathon with MSWE and the Medical Center, and it has been a great success!‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúWe look forward to collaborating in the future with physicians and staff from more varied medical departments.‚Äù
Moshirpour also plans to collaborate with UCI‚Äôs [Beall Applied Innovation Center](https://innovation.uci.edu/) as well as the [Paul Merage School of Business](https://merage.uci.edu/), ensuring additional opportunities for entrepreneurship based on the hackathon prototypes. ‚ÄúWe want this Dev Shop initiative to lead to options for finding potential investors and development teams. This will be very exciting for researchers and students alike.‚Äù
For information on how to get involved, email Mohammad Moshirpour at [mmoshirp@uci.edu](mailto:mmoshirp@uci.edu).

organizations.name: UC Irvine‚Äôs Department of Informatics and Department of Anesthesiology & Perioperative Care

author: Anonym
title: Syria reports heavy Israeli airstrikes ‚Äì Damascus airport hit - Teller Report
text: Enlarge image Damascus International Airport Photo: YOUSSEF BADAWI / EPA-EFE Attacks in the dark: Israel has again attacked targets near the capital Damascus, according to Syrian state media and the Ministry of Defense. Air defenses are targeting "enemy targets" near the city, the state news agency Sana said on Thursday. Syrian state television also reported Israeli attacks from the Damascus area. According to the Syrian Defense Ministry, the attacks were carried out from the Israeli-occupied Golan Heights. The agency did not report any casualties of the shelling. According to the UK-based Syrian Observatory for Human Rights, the strikes targeted an air defense position in the southern Syrian province of Suweida, as well as the area around Damascus International Airport. The airport had only reopened a day earlier ‚Äì after being closed for several weeks as a result of an earlier Israeli airstrike at the end of November. In October, the airports in Damascus and Aleppo in northwestern Syria had already been forced to suspend operations twice following Israeli air strikes. In general, Israel rarely comments on individual attacks in Syria. However, it has repeatedly stressed that it will not allow its arch-enemy Iran to expand its presence in Syria. Tehran is allied with Syrian ruler Bashar al-Assad. Since the beginning of the Syrian civil war in 2011, Israel has shelled the neighboring country from the air hundreds of times. The attacks are directed in particular against the Iranian-backed Lebanese Hezbollah militia, but also against positions of the Syrian army. Since the start of the war against the Hezbollah-allied radical Islamic Palestinian organization Hamas nearly two months ago, Israel has intensified airstrikes in Syria. dop/AFP

author: John Pike
title: Pakistan announces end of tensions with Iran
text:
Pakistan announces end of tensions with Iran
IRNA - Islamic Republic News Agency
Jan 19, 2024
Islamabad, IRNA -- After today's meeting of Pakistan's National Security Committee, the members of the country's cabinet agreed with the final decision of the political and military leaders to resume full diplomatic relations with the Islamic Republic of Iran and return the ambassadors of the two countries to each other's capitals.
An emergency meeting of the National Security Committee of Pakistan was held in Islamabad under the chairmanship of Anwar ul-Haq Kakar, Pakistan's caretaker prime minister.
According to the decision of the National Security Committee of Pakistan, this country has resumed the full level of diplomatic relations with Iran and soon the ambassadors of Iran and Pakistan will be sent to each other's capitals.
Meanwhile, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Pakistan announced that in a telephone call today, the foreign ministers of Pakistan and the Islamic Republic of Pakistan discussed the return of the ambassadors of the two countries to each other's capitals.
Jalil Abbas Jilani and Hossein Amirabdollahian agreed that cooperation at the working level and close coordination in the field of counter-terrorism and other aspects of mutual concern should be strengthened.
Foreign ministers of Iran and Pakistan also agreed to reduce tensions.
The statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Pakistan states: Jalil Abbas Jilani emphasized that respect for territorial integrity and sovereignty should be the basis of bilateral cooperation.
Emphasizing the close and brotherly relations between Pakistan and Iran, he expressed Islamabad's willingness to cooperate with Tehran based on the spirit of trust and mutual cooperation.
2050
|
|
NEWSLETTER
|Join the GlobalSecurity.org mailing list|
|
||
|

author: @zazoomblog
title: Scozia-Polonia dopo Gilmour ecco McTominay | il centrocampista del Napoli firma il gol del 2-2 VIDEO
text: Fonte : sportface di 5 set 2024 Scozia-Polonia dopo Gilmour ecco McTominay | il centrocampista del Napoli firma il gol del 2-2 VIDEO Scozia-Polonia, dopo Gilmour ecco McTominay: il centrocampista del Napoli firma il gol del 2-2 (VIDEO) (Di gioved√É¬¨ 5 settembre 2024) Scott McTominay firma il gol del 2-2 in Scozia - Polonia , match di Lega A in Nations League 2024/2025. Al 77? su cross di Ralston, il centrocampista del Napoli si √É¬® fatto trovare pronto in area e ha deviato in rete col destro. Una rimonta quella della Scozia targata Napoli , visto che al 46? a riaprire la partita era stato Gilmour .
